description: Assesses student's ability to write an engaging story beginning

levels.4: Opening immediately captures attention with action, mystery, or surprise that makes reader eager to continue
levels.3: Opening creates some interest and makes reader curious to know more
levels.2: Opening is present but doesn't create strong curiosity; somewhat predictable
levels.1: No clear attempt to hook the reader; begins with plain statement

feedback_stems.strength: Your beginning grabbed my attention when you wrote
feedback_stems.growth: To make your beginning even more exciting, try starting with

levels.4: Main character is clearly introduced with at least one interesting detail that makes them memorable
levels.3: Main character is named and we know at least one thing about them
levels.2: There seems to be a main character but we don't learn much about them

feedback_stems.strength: I liked learning about your character when you said
feedback_stems.growth: Help readers get to know your character better by telling us

levels.4: Setting is clear with sensory details that help readers picture where the story happens
levels.3: Setting is mentioned and reader has a general idea of where the story takes place
levels.2: Some hint of setting but location is vague or confusing
levels.1: No setting established; reader doesn't know where the story happens

feedback_stems.strength: You helped me picture the place when you wrote
feedback_stems.growth: Add details about what your character can see, hear, or feel in this place

4.label: Exceeds Expectations
4.feedback_tone: Celebrate excellence with specific praise; suggest enrichment challenges

3.label: Meets Expectations
3.feedback_tone: Acknowledge solid work; identify one area to elevate to excellence

2.label: Approaching
2.feedback_tone: Encourage progress; focus on most impactful improvement

1.label: Beginning
1.feedback_tone: Focus on effort; provide concrete next steps without overwhelming
